intro: Miconia lambayequensis, commonly known as the Lambayeque miconia, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to the western Amazon basin. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in diameter. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, attracting various pollinators. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release numerous small seeds. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
